thesisAbstract: Since traditional anomaly detection methods are stable, robust and easy to use, it is vitally important to generalize them to graph data.
thesisTitle: One-Class Graph Neural Networks for Anomaly Detection in Attributed Networks

thesisAbstract: We present an approach to efficiently and effectively adapt a masked image modeling (MIM) pre-trained vanilla Vision Transformer (ViT) for object detection, which is based on our two novel observations: (i) A MIM pre-trained vanilla ViT can work surprisingly well in the challenging object-level recognition scenario even with random sampled partial observations, e. g., only 25% ~ 50% of the input sequence.
thesisTitle: Unleashing Vanilla Vision Transformer with Masked Image Modeling for Object Detection

thesisAbstract: By decomposing the image formation process into a sequential application of denoising autoencoders, diffusion models (DMs) achieve state-of-the-art synthesis results on image data and beyond.
thesisTitle: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models

thesisAbstract: We show this pre-training strategy leads to a flexible, simple, and efficient framework with improved transfer results to downstream tasks.
Optical flow, which captures motion information across frames, is exploited in recent video inpainting methods through propagating pixels along its trajectories.
thesisTitle: Towards An End-to-End Framework for Flow-Guided Video Inpainting

thesisAbstract: We find that one of the main reasons for that is the lack of an effective receptive field in both the inpainting network and the loss function.
thesisTitle: Resolution-robust Large Mask Inpainting with Fourier Convolutions

thesisAbstract: Using a split/merge framework, a dynamic architecture that adapts to the changing K, and a novel loss, our proposed method outperforms existing nonparametric methods (both classical and deep ones).
thesisTitle: DeepDPM: Deep Clustering With an Unknown Number of Clusters

thesisAbstract: The Transformer architecture has improved the performance of deep learning models in domains such as Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing.
thesisTitle: Colossal-AI: A Unified Deep Learning System For Large-Scale Parallel Training

thesisAbstract: We train a family of large language models, called CodeGen, on natural language and programming language data.
thesisTitle: A Conversational Paradigm for Program Synthesis

thesisAbstract: We present a self-supervised method to learn dynamic 3D deformations of garments worn by parametric human bodies.
